== About me ==
My name is Paolo Pisati, and I joined Canonical as an Embedded Kernel Engineer on March 1st, 2011.
I am currently working as a Kernel Engineer in the <nowiki>[[KernelTeam|{{https:--launchpadlibrarian.net-7080714-ubuntu-kernel-team-small.png}}]]</nowiki><nowiki>[[KernelTeam|Ubuntu Kernel Team]]</nowiki>, mainly on the Unstable and Devel kernel trees. I graduated from Universita' Statale di Milano (Italy) in 2003 with a Laurea degree in Computer Science.

I have contributed to many open-source projects in the past, and i've grown a particular interest for the Linux kernel.

== My Ubuntu story ==
I started using GNU/Linux around 1999 (when i first installed a Debian m68k derivative on my Amiga called "Watch Tower"). I used several Unix variants since then (FreeBSD in particular) and i moved to Ubuntu around 2006. Since then it has been my Linux distro of choice for workstations and servers.

== Plans for the future ==
I plan to continue working in the Development Kernel Team, improving the development workflow, and getting more involved in other areas (like kernel testing).

=== Stefan Bader ===

==== General feedback ====

I did some reviews on some kernels Paolo uploaded. It has been a while ago but I do not remember to have had any major issues with them. Since then he did work on maintaining the arm derivatives and later moved on to work on the development release side.
- From past and general experience I would trust Paolo to exercise the powers coming with upload rights carefully. I have no objections granting PPU rights.

==== Areas of Improvement ====

Not strictly as improvement but anybody with PPU should occationally come back and do a SRU crank or two. ;)
